thinking.disposable_income: Greater Heights residents have relatively high disposable income with a median household income around $110,000, significantly above Houston's average.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: The neighborhood has high discretionary spending power, with residents frequently patronizing local businesses, restaurants, and entertainment venues along Heights Boulevard and 19th Street.
thinking.accessibility: The area has good road access with I-10 and I-45 nearby, decent bus service, and is relatively close to downtown, though most residents rely on personal vehicles for transportation.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Given high income levels, residents can absorb moderate fees and taxes while valuing time savings 2) Most residents drive but would benefit from reduced congestion 3) Higher driver fees and taxes can improve transit without severely impacting discretionary spending 4) Policies balancing moderate taxes with higher driver fees offer best congestion reduction 5) Selected proposals that reduce both car and transit travel times while maintaining reasonable costs 6) Ranked choices prioritize overall system efficiency while acknowledging car-dependent nature of community
